channel.title: How would I go about doing this?
channel.description:
Ok, so my thing is this. I'm trying to fix the animations, so like, when I'm walking holding a greataxe, it doesn't look like Im holding a maul. So I made some arrays of the correct animations depending on the weapon(s) wielded, (whenRunning[], whenWalking[], whenStanding[],whenFlinching[] and whenAttacking[]) and put them in a folder. So after I did all that, I suddenly realised I didn't know how to make the client.java go to those arrays! My question: What do I put in client.java to make it go to those arrays?
Thanks :).[br][size=1]Posted at: October 27, 2006, 10:27:15 PM[/size][hr]Cmon... I know somebody out there knows! You all have those Javafull brains...

item.title: How would I go about doing this?
item.dc:creator: @samuraiblood2 samuraiblood2
item.description:
@samuraiblood2 wrote:

lol ok im going to bed night ^_^[br][size=1]Posted at: October 27, 2006, 11:48:37 PM[/size][hr]here this is what i made so far on the veary limited advil i have [code] BufferedWriter bw = null;

  try { 
     bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("C:/animations/whenRuning.txt", true));

bw.write(pEmote = animation.whenAttacking[itemID]);
bw.newLine();
bw.flush();
} catch (IOException ioe) {
ioe.printStackTrace();
} finally {
if (bw != null) try {
bw.close();
} catch (IOException ioe2) {
}
}
}[/code] you put that somewhere in client.java but you get 2 errors im to lazzy to fix

Read full topic
